subtitle: This tasty quiche is made with an onion pastry. Serve hot or cold.

method.text: Sift the flour and salt into a bowl. Rub in the butter until the mixture resembles fine breadcrumbs. Stir in the onion flakes. Add enough cold water to form a soft dough.
Turn the dough out onto a lightly floured surface and knead until smooth. Roll out and use to line a 20 cm round fluted flan case. Prick the base with a fork. Chill for 20 min.
Line the pastry case with greaseproof paper. Fill with baking beans. Bake blind for 10 min. Remove the paper and beans and cook for a further 5 min or until firm.
In a jug, beat together the eggs, cream, seasoning, tomato puree and chives. Sprinkle the salami and tomatoes over the pastry case. Pour over the egg mixture and smooth over the surface.
Place the flan tin on a baking tray and bake for 20 min or until firm and golden.

title: Spicy salami, tomato and herb quiche
